title.narrative: IMPROVED Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: Vulnerable girls and boys, adolescents and their families have increased access to water, sanitation, and hygiene services in targeted municipalities., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 children, adolescents, youth and their families, especially the most disadvantaged, are increasingly using improved quality basic services.

sector.narrative: Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
Water Supply in communities –service delivery – urban
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable girls and boys, adolescents and their families have increased access to water, sanitation, and hygiene services intargeted municipalities.

description.narrative: WASH interventions contributed to mitigating the impact of disease outbreak and COVID-19 infection, especially for the most vulnerable populations. UNICEF worked in partnership with line ministries and national partners to support emergency and resilient basic service delivery, capacity building and evidence generation. WASH interventions, including provision of safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene promotion, reached 245,043 people. Additionally, 509 people were provided with WASH IPC training services to reduce risks from COVID-19. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
